title: Cannot stay logged in to Facebook
content:
Hello. Can someone please explain why Facebook asks for username/password every single time Firefox is restarted? I do not use cookie-cleaning extensions. They also send a 'login attempt' email and phone notification every time.

Tried with and without Facebook Container. Not using other Container/multi-account related extensions. My settings:

Standard Tracking Protection (allow/block exceptions: none) "Do not track" signal: Always Delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed: disabled (no exceptions) History - Firefox will: Remember History

Thank you
creator: c_santucci

title: Sound quality output is different between Firefox and Tor
content: Maybe not an issue. Anyway i discovered that playing the same youtube video on my computer, the sound quality coming from Tor (based on Firefox 102.15.1) is much better than the sound coming from Firefox 118.0.2. Test made using the latest browsers version available. Platform Windows 10 64-bit
creator: albertocalanna

title: Mozilla became itself the very evil it says it fights...
content:
I have been following the change in the wind direction for a while...and today I got the silliest yet practical evidence of that... Flooded with hipsters from a lost generation of shiny and empty queer arguments the Mozilla project lost its tracks on providing technical, secure, and safe material to its community. Today I decided to remove Snap from my Linux box, consequently, Firefox. Then I went to install Firefox through Apt and I realized the "apt" is actually a "transition package to snap"...fine. I then went to the website to download and install it manually (like the good old days), and then I realize there are no instructions for installing the package. You are supposed to figure that out by yourself...

Again, I give you that: the fact *is* silly, but is shows a broken system, and this broken system is done by those young hipsters full of schema, and colourful, and "inclusive" arguments that don't really care about the actual user but their own egos. For instance, go here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/firefox/install-and-update-firefox. Go there, get your Firefox. And, please, notice that there is not *a single line* explaining how to install this thing. There is -- like every lazy tech company out there, profit from the "free" time of their costumers -- a list of "#f*ckyourself" articles to search for your answer...

That's just too much BS... especially for somebody that actually donate money to what once was a symbol of openess and dedication to users. This hipsters probably don't even know the relevance of Mozilla/Netspace to the world of open-source and freedom... I bet they/you don't... I actually get mad at me to allow these loosers to take over what was a awesome project.

With that, I quit Firefox and Mozilla. Until you refresh your cynical management and community leaders...
creator: kk.brandt

Is there a way to fix this? This doesn't happen with Edge or Chrome...

title: When I download a pdf from ebay and try to open it with firefox or adobe it is saying undefined

title: Bookmark Multiple Tabs into A Single Folder Has Stopped Working
content: Several months ago I lost the ability to bookmark multiple tabs into a new Folder. When I perform the procedure and give the new folder a unique name, the selected bookmarks appear in the generic "Bookmarks Menu" section and the folder I specified with the unique name is created but is empty. Also, I cannot even store a single tab to an existing folder of Bookmarks. When I select the existing folder after CNTRL+D, the bookmark just goes to my generic "Bookmarks Menu" section and not to the existing folder I selected. I have reloaded Firefox but the problem continues. Can someone help me? Thanks.
creator: bobdawsonvenice

title: Most recentFirefox update 118.0.2 of Oct 10 caused comments on a website made though Disqus to be invisible.
